commitResults.messageTitle: 1. Renamed chatbot to B33PBOP and updated all references of Duke to B33PBOP 2. Implemented skeletal version of B33PBOP: greets user and exits
Implemented echo functionality: When user types an input, the bot echos the input and exits only if user inputs bye
Added a new list functionality for users to add whatever they input. Created a Task class to represent each user input to be stored in my list
Added a task complete status functionality: users can mark or unmark tasks as done
Added todo, deadline and event task options with a factory class to handle which method to call
Added automated testing for the features up to the previous commit + fixed string formatting in TaskFactory that was treating command as task name
Added new Exception class and subclass to handle command errors
Added delete task function and exception handling for when: 1. deleting from empty task list 2. deleting a non-existent task id 3. deleting a negative task id
Changed commands to be represented by enum
Update B33POBP.java to follow Java coding standards
commitResults.messageBody:
My project was originally 2 spacing indented. The indentation has been changed to 4 spaces.

The switch statement in B33PBOP.java has been updated to match the documented indentation. Descriptions for the class (class header), class variable and class methods. Constants declared have also been updated to match SCREAMING_SNAKE_CASE and some variable names have been updated following Javadoc standards.

commitResults.messageTitle: Separate task list logic from B33PBOP.java
commitResults.messageBody:
As the functionality of task list scale, it would be better to separate the concerns of task list actions from that of the bot actions.

I created a new TaskList.java file to handle the task functions while keeping the response functionality within the bot itself.

Along with these changes, I updated the necessary methods and exception handling to fit this new structure.

TODO:
* Update the comments of new methods I created and old methods I changed/moved

Create Storage class to handle file/folder creation and file updates.
Storage update logic is handled within B33PBOP.

commitResults.messageTitle: Validate and format event date/time input for EventTask and DeadlineTask
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous implementation accepted any String as input for time without checking for input validity. This allows inconsistent inputs.

Current implementation validates user date time inputs and parses them to (MM dd yyyy) for deadline tasks and (MM dd yyyy HH:mm) for event tasks.

The parsing is done in a new DateTimeParser class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Split functionality of B33PBOP into separate files
commitResults.messageBody:
As the bot functionality scales, code and functionality within B33PBOP gets more cluttered and messy. To handle scalability, the command handling has been separated into a new CommandExecutor interface along with its subclasses.

Fix a bug with parsing date time when loading tasks from storage. Storage format did not fit the input format of deadline and event task creation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix Date Time formatting of event and deadline tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Fix issue with datetime parsing when loading event and deadline tasks from storage.
Set up gradle to automate build tasks for B33PBOP.

Wrote JUnit tests for TodoTask methods and DeadlineTask methods.

Wrote tests for B33PBOP's main command running loop, testing startup, add commands and exit command.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix code to match coding standard

commitResults.messageBody:
Users can search for tasks using the find command followed by a keyword of what they are searching for.

E.g. find work

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch-Level-9 into master and resolve conflicts

commitResults.messageBody:
Updated package naming from full upper case to lower case.

Changed B33PBOP class to B33pbop to align with checkstyle.

Fixed order of imports for all java files including tests and finished up incomplete JavaDoc.

Found a typo in class name. Originally was ToDoTaskTest, changed to TodoTaskTest to match filename.

Created a package for files in charge of handling gui: chatbot.gui

Using JavaFx, commands are no longer read and respond through a scanner and while loop. To tackle this, all response methods in UI.java had to be changed to return a String instead of printing to console.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assert statements to validate key inputs and refactor code: simplify nested logic and improve abstraction
commitResults.messageBody:
With the implementation of the GUI, code debugging is considerably harder without printing output or errors to the CLI.

Adding assert statements helps developers identify bugs in the code such as null or empty inputs.

These changes make the code easier to debug.

Additionally, nested loops and conditionals in the code reduced readability and lead to overly long methods.

Refactored methods reduced nesting and shorten method lengths to improve abstraction.

These abstractions did not change functionality but improved scalability of the code and ease of debugging.
Add assert statements to validate key inputs and refactor code: simplify nested logic and improve abstraction

Previously, the execute method of command classes did not have a prominent happy path. Instead, it made use of if, else blocks.

Guard clauses were moved to the front which allowed me to remove the else block, reducing indentation and improving readability of the code.

The existsInTaskDescription method of EventTask.java had a complicated return statement with nested function calls and 2 or operators.

This made the conditions difficult to follow and understand.

Each nested function call was broken down and stored into several intermediate variables.

This helped simplify the return statement into just 2 operands and a or operator which improves readability.
Code Refactor: Improve code readability

Some of the javaDoc were outdated or did not match standards.

This commit updates header comments to be more descriptive.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor TaskList: Use Streams for Collections
commitResults.messageBody:
* Replace for-loops in showTaskList() and findTasks() with Streams
* Improve readability and conciseness
* Keep behavior unchanged
Refactor TaskList: Use Streams for Collections
